title: [JIT][script] Support non-tensor arguments and returns in functions
body_html:
import torch
@torch.jit.script
def fn():
    return 0
fn()


RuntimeError:
expected a tensor value but found a int:
@torch.jit.script
def fn():
    return 0
    ~~~~~~~~ <--- HERE

And

In [12]: import torch
    ...: @torch.jit.script
    ...: def fn(i):
    ...:     return torch.full([1], 0)
    ...:
    ...: fn(1)
    ...:
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
RuntimeError                              Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-12-9385ebcc9434> in <module>()
      4     return torch.full([1], 0)
      5
----> 6 fn(1)

RuntimeError: Unable to cast Python instance to C++ type (compile in debug mode for details)

body:
```
import torch
@torch.jit.script
def fn():
    return 0
fn()


RuntimeError:
expected a tensor value but found a int:
@torch.jit.script
def fn():
    return 0
    ~~~~~~~~ <--- HERE
```

And 

```
In [12]: import torch
    ...: @torch.jit.script
    ...: def fn(i):
    ...:     return torch.full([1], 0)
    ...:
    ...: fn(1)
    ...:
---------------------------------------------------------------------------

<ipython-input-12-9385ebcc9434> in <module>()
      4     return torch.full([1], 0)
      5
----> 6 fn(1)
```
